newsitem.title: MACEDONIA: SOCCER-MACEDONIA KEEP ALIVE HOPE OF FINALS PLACE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MACEDONIA KEEP ALIVE HOPE OF FINALS PLACE.

text.p: A 53rd minute strike by Gjorgi Hristov kept alive Macedonia's hopes of a place in the World Cup finals in France next year.
Macedonia won the European group eight qualifier against Iceland 1-0, putting them second, five points behind Romania, who have a game in hand.
Following an uneventful first half, Macedonia brought on forward Viktor Trenevski, who plays for Yugoslav champions Partizan Belgrade.
Trenevski laid on the pass for Hristov to score with a powerful 18-metre volley.
Minutes later, Macedonian defender Goce Sedloski saved on the line when Iceland pushed forward after two attacking substitutions.
Home captain Toni Micevski was shown the red card for dissent 15 minutes before time.
